intro: Chassalia subherbacea, commonly known as the dwarf chassalia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are lanceolate and hairy, with small, yellowish flower heads that bloom in late summer. It is native to South Africa and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Due to its compact size and ornamental flowers, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and as a ground cover.
